definition: Brokeback Mountain, 2005 English-language film by Ang Lee 李安[Li3 An1]
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: "We herded sheep on Brokeback one summer, " said Ennis.
sentences.chinese: “有一年夏天，我们在断背山上放羊”安尼斯说。

sentences.english: Forget “Brokeback Mountain”, with its distracting scenery.
sentences.chinese: 忘掉《断背山》以及电影中美得让人分心的景色吧。

sentences.english: On "Brokeback Mountain, " I felt you with me every day.
sentences.chinese: 在拍《断背山》时，我觉得每天你们都和我在一起。

sentences.english: Broke Back Mountain created a lot of controversy when in came out in theaters throughout the United States.
sentences.chinese: 断背山上映后在整个美国引起众多争议。

pinyin: Zheng3 jiu4 Da4 bing1 Rui4 en1

definition: spring sunshine emerges to bring the world alive (idiom)/to give a glimpse of sth intimate (e.g. one's underwear)
